O‘zbekistonda 2020-yil 1-yanvardan jismoniy shaxslar uchun yagona bojxona to‘lovi joriy etiladi

07 Nov 2019, 21:41

O‘zbekiston Prezident 7-noyabr kuni “Jismoniy shaxslar tomonidan shaxsiy ehtiyojlari uchun tovarlarni olib o‘tish tartibini yanada takomillashtirish to‘g‘risida” qarorni imzoladi. Bu haqda Adliya vazirligi xabar berdi.


Foto: “Gazeta.uz”

Qarorga muvofiq, 2020-yil 1-yanvardan quyidagi tartiblar belgilandi:

notijorat maqsadlar uchun O‘zbekistonning davlat chegarasidan o‘tish punktlari orqali qo‘l yukida va kuzatib borilayotgan yukida tovarlar olib kirayotgan jismoniy shaxslar uchun, shuningdek, jismoniy shaxs nomiga xalqaro pochta va kuryerlik jo‘natmalari orqali keladigan tovarlarga nisbatan qonun hujjatlarida belgilangan bojxona boji, qo‘shilgan qiymat solig‘i va aksiz solig‘i o‘rniga yagona bojxona to‘lovini to‘lashni nazarda tutuvchi bojxona to‘lovlarini undirishning soddalashtirilgan tartibi joriy etiladi;
jismoniy shaxslar tomonidan shaxsiy ehtiyojlari uchun bojxona chegarasi orqali qo‘l yukida, kuzatib borilayotgan yukida, shuningdek, pochta jo‘natmalari orqali olib kiriladigan hayvonotga mansub oziq-ovqat mahsulotlarida ishlab chiqarish o‘rovining majburiy mavjudligi to‘g‘risidagi talab o‘rnatiladi.

Shuningdek, yagona bojxona to‘lovi bojxona to‘lovlari undirilmaydigan tovarlarni jismoniy shaxslar tomonidan respublikaga olib kirishning cheklangan me’yorlaridan ortgan taqdirda, O‘zbekiston Respublikasi Tashqi iqtisodiy faoliyat tovar nomenklaturasi kodidan va kelib chiqish mamlakatidan qat’i nazar tovarlarning barcha toifalari bo‘yicha bojxona qiymatidan kelib chiqqan holda, cheklangan me’yorlardan ortiq qismiga nisbatan undiriladi.
Qaror bilan quyidagilar tasdiqlandi:

tovarning bojxona qiymatidan 30 foiz, lekin har bir kilogrami uchun 3 dollardan kam bo‘lmagan miqdorda yagona bojxona to‘lovi stavkasi;
Jismoniy shaxslar tomonidan shaxsiy ehtiyojlari uchun olib kiriladigan tovarlar toifasiga kirmaydigan tovarlar ro‘yxati.

Avvaloq Davlat bojxona qo‘mitasi mazkur qaror loyihasini muhokamaga qo‘ygan va unga izoh bergan edi.

Uzbekistan will introduce single customs duties for individuals from 1 January 2020

07 Nov 2019, 21:41

On November 7, the President of Uzbekistan signed a decree "On further improvement of the procedures for the transportation of goods for personal needs by individuals". This was reported by the Ministry of Justice.


Photo: “Gazeta.uz”

In accordance with the decision, from January 1, 2020, the following procedures are established:

customs duties established by the legislation for non-commercial purposes, for individuals importing goods in hand luggage and accompanied luggage through the state border crossing points of Uzbekistan, as well as in goods sent by international mail and courier a simplified procedure for collection of customs duties, which envisages the payment of a single customs tax for VAT and excise tax;
There is a requirement for individuals for their own needs to be produced at the customs border, in the hand luggage, in the luggage they carry, and in the packaging of animal products that are delivered by mail.

In addition, if the single customs payment exceeds the limit for importation of non-levied goods by natural persons into all categories of goods irrespective of the code of the Commodity Nomenclature of Foreign Economic Activity and the country of origin. levied on the customs value, exceeding the limit.
The following was approved by the Resolution:

a single customs duty rate of 30 percent of the customs value of the goods, but not less than $ 3 per kilogram;
List of goods that do not fall under the category of goods imported by natural persons for personal needs.

Earlier, the State Customs Committee had discussed and commented on the draft resolution.
